answers.answer: Hello,It can be due to parasthesia skin which is due to dysfunctioning of neurons and seems unrelated to the miscarriage. It can be due to diabetes, hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency, neujrological causes or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms improve. If the symptoms persist then get the above mentioned possibilities ruled out from a neurologist.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: So I had this "buzzing" like a cell phone vibration throughout my pelvic area and down into my groin. I was told it was nothing to worry about. Two weeks later I had a miscarriage 12 weeks into my pregnancy. I'm wondering if it is related.
title: Vibrating or buzzing sensation in pelvic area
